[500 uM ATP,
[100 uM GTP,
[10 mM]
[1 unit/ul]
[100 ug/ml]
Resuspend DNA in 5 ul H20.
Add 10 ul 5X Transcription Buffer
10 ul 5X Nucleotides
5 ul 10X (Cap)
5 ul 100mM DTT
60 units RNasin
5 ug BSA
alpha 32units SP6 RNA Polymerase
Incubate 2 hrs.

2mM 
40 deg. C.
After reaction add 7ul RQ1 DNase 1 to
digest DNA template. Incubate 20 min. 37 deg. C.
Extract reaction with equal volume
phenol/chloroform and 1X chloroform. Bring final
aqueous vol. to 0.3M ph 5.2, and add 2.5 vol.
to precipitate. (note: it generally takes a
higher Concentration of to precipitate
RNA than it does DNA). Precipitate for a couple of
hours at -20 deg. C.
Spin RNA 20 min. in microfuge. Pipet off and
discard as radioactive waste (note: some will
precipitate with the RNA, and some will remain in
solution in Rinse the tube with 1 ml 70%
and discard as radioactive waste. Dry tube.
Pour the storage buffer off NICK column (prepacked
G-50 size exclusion column). Suspend column behind
protective shield and fill to the top with 0.3M
Na0Ac pH 5.2. Allow column to empty completely then
repeat. Allow columnn to drain almost to
completion, then cap the top to stop flow.
Resuspend RNA in 80 ul H20. Allow NICK column to
drain completely. Add RNA to column and let it
enter, collecting effluent in disposable tube. Add
exactly 400 ul of Na0Ac to column and let run
through (note: no radioactivity should have yet
eluted from column). Again add exactly 400 ul of
Na0Ac and collect eluent in clean, labelled 1.5 ml
microcentrifuge tube. This fraction contains the
all the unincorporated nucleotides will remain
in column. Add 1 ml of to Precipitate. Store
at -20 deg. C.
